fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.design

Interface IPasswordAuthnDesign

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAttachable, IThemedDesign

    public interface IPasswordAuthnDesign
extends IThemedDesign
    Provides an authentication form for a password-based authentication service.

    The design is expected to submit a form using HTTP POST containing the fields:

    • principal (the user's "login" identifier).
    • credentials (the user's password).

    Note: implementations are permitted to defer persistence of design configuration changes for up to a second, to efficiently store a batch of changes. If the design configuration is externally updated when changes are pending (for example, by modifying a configuration file) then the deferred changes will be lost.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IPasswordAuthnPage, IPlatformAuthnService

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String PARAM_CREDENTIALS
      Parameter that authenticates the user (the password), and that should be recognized by a compatible authentication filter.
      static String PARAM_PRINCIPAL
      Parameter that identifies the user (the "login", or "username"), and that should be recognized by a compatible authentication filter.

    • Field Detail

      • PARAM_PRINCIPAL

        static final String PARAM_PRINCIPAL
        Parameter that identifies the user (the "login", or "username"), and that should be recognized by a compatible authentication filter. This parameter is generally submitted using an HTML form.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getMaxPrincipalLength(), Constant Field Values

      • PARAM_CREDENTIALS

        Parameter that authenticates the user (the password), and that should be recognized by a compatible authentication filter. This parameter is generally submitted using an HTML form.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getMaxCredentialsLength(), Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxPrincipalLength

        int getMaxPrincipalLength()
        Gets the maximum length for the principal parameter. This can be used to avoid submitting some forms of invalid input to the authentication server.
        Returns:
        the maximum length, as a number of characters. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that no length restriction should be applied (not recommended).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        PARAM_PRINCIPAL

      • getMaxCredentialsLength

        int getMaxCredentialsLength()
        Gets the maximum length for the credentials parameter. Even for credentials that are stored as secure fixed-length hashes based on arbitrary-length passwords, this can be used to avoid submitting malicious input that could cause denials of service by overloading a resource-intensive secure hash generator with excessive amounts of data.
        Returns:
        the maximum length, as a number of characters. A value of 0 (zero) indicates that no length restriction should be applied (not recommended).
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        PARAM_CREDENTIALS

      • getRedirectingExtensions

        Set<String> getRedirectingExtensions()
        Gets the set of path extensions for file resources that are allowed to automatically redirect to the sign-on URI instead of returning an HTTP FORBIDDEN status code.
        Returns:
        a non-null set, containing values such as "txt" or "html", used to select content requests to intercept with a redirection response. If an attempt to access a file with no extension (by an unauthenticated user) is intended to trigger redirection, then this set should also contain an empty string.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isRedirectingCollections()

      • isRedirectingCollections

        boolean isRedirectingCollections()
        Indicates whether collection resources (requests for paths ending in "/") are allowed to automatically redirect to the sign-on URI instead of returning an HTTP FORBIDDEN status code.

        Note that the base path ("/", with nothing after it) is always allowed to redirect to the sign-on URI, irrespective of the value of this property.

        Returns:
        true if unauthenticated collection requests should by default trigger redirection response, or false to trigger a HTTP FORBIDDEN status code instead.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getRedirectingExtensions()

      • getConnectUri

        String getConnectUri()
        Gets the relative URI to use for one-time password connection.

        Assuming that the value is "/connect/", then the OTP URL must be constructed in the format "/connect/:principal/:otp" (where ":principal" and ":otp" must be replaced with the appropriate values).

        This feature requires an available instance of IPlatformAuthnService in order to function.

        Note: this cannot map to the base path ("/") as the ":principal" parameter would then collide with other registered address spaces.

        Returns:
        the relative URI, which must start and end with "/", and not contain special characters used when defining address spaces (such as "*" and "::").
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPageRouter.isValidConnectUri(String)

      • getSignOnUri

        String getSignOnUri()
        Gets the relative URI to use for the sign-on form. Following processing, a redirect will be issued to the user's home URI.
        Returns:
        the relative URI, which (to be valid) must start with "/", and not contain special characters used when defining address spaces (such as "*" and "::").
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPageRouter.isValidUri(String)

      • getSignOffUri

        String getSignOffUri()
        Gets the relative URI to use for signing-off. After signing-off, the client will be redirected, to either (in order of preference):
        • the exit URI if defined and valid, or
        • the sign-on URI if defined and valid, or
        • the base URI of the application ("/").
        Returns:
        the relative URI, which (to be valid) must start with "/", and not contain special characters used when defining address spaces (such as "*" and "::").
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPageRouter.isValidUri(String)

      • getExitUri

        String getExitUri()
        Gets the absolute URL or relative URI to which a client should be redirected after signing-off. For this to be effective, it should be valid and not refer to a URI that is protected by a IPageGuard.
        Returns:
        the absolute URL, or the relative URI, which (to be valid) must start with "/", and not contain special characters used when defining address spaces (such as "*" and "::").
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPageRouter.isValidUri(String)
